greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Period 6: repeat [1, 1, 1, -1, -1, -1].
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,0,-1).
formula: a(n) = ((-1)^n * (4 * (cos((2*n + 1)*Pi/3) + cos(n*Pi)) + 1) - 4) / 3. - Federico Acha Neckar (f0383864(AT)hotmail.com), Sep 01 2007
a(n) = (-1)^n * (4 * cos((2*n + 1) * Pi/3) + 1) / 3. - Federico Acha Neckar (f0383864(AT)hotmail.com), Sep 02 2007
a(n) = 3*a(n-1) - a(n-3) + 3*a(n-4) for n>3. - _Paul Curtz_, Nov 22 2007

a(n) = (-1)^floor(n/3). Compare with A057077, A143621 and A143622. Define E(k) = Sum_{n >= 0} a(n)*n^k/n! for k = 0,1,2,... . Then E(k) is an integral linear combination of E(0), E(1) and E(2) (a Dobinski-type relation). Precisely, E(k) = A143628(k) *E(0) + A143629(k) *E(1) + A143630(k) *E(2). - _Peter Bala_, Aug 28 2008
Euler transform of length 6 sequence [1, 0, -2, 0, 0, 1]. - _Michael Somos_, Feb 26 2011
a(n) = b(2*n + 1) where b(n) is multiplicative with b(2^e) = 0^e, b(3^e) = -(-1)^e if e>0, b(p^e) = 1 if p == 1 (mod 4), b(p^e) = (-1)^e if p == 3 (mod 4) and p>3. - _Michael Somos_, Feb 26 2011
a(n + 3) = a(-1 - n) = -a(n) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Feb 26 2011
a(n) = (-1)^n * A257075(n) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Apr 15 2015
a(n)*a(n-4) = a(n-1)*a(n-3) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Feb 25 2020
results.author: _Paul Curtz_, Aug 03 2007
